pros: Hillside is truly the best place to work compared to other PRTF facilities serving C&A population in Atlanta and the region in general. HR is incredibly supportive and represent nothing less than a “dream team.” Visionary medical director, excellent and accessible CEO and engaged workforce with far more in-house and ongoing training to guide client care. The pay is above the industry average and annual merit raises make advancement a clear and attainable path. Numerous 10+ year employees in nursing department, which is unheard of in our field and specialty.  Excellent work environment with relaxed and fun atmosphere.
cons: Interdepartmental communication is truly challenging and should be addressed with more face-to-face communication as email is relied heavily upon for every operational aspect of care.  Nursing department not given same training opportunities as other departments. No security officers and unsecured campus create unacceptable risk in the current climate of gun violence, especially given the population served.  The campus also needs 24 hour reception services bc all evening and weekend reception is put on nurses, and the phone and traffic flow are overwhelming and detract from nursing care.  Laidback culture can be overly permissive and oblivious to regulatory compliance and risk.

you work 12 hour shifts

Please be cautious when applying-Just because the website looks like  the ideal place to work..do your research

The management has no connection with the actual behavior specialist. Of course they may speak to you.  But they truly have no understanding of how it life is on the cottages. My suggestion is work as a UNIT.  Make sure everyone is on the same page, have proper supervision.

review_title: A Lifetime Experience & Adventure where dreams come True
pros:
The Clients & Staff! The clients are a variety from all over the world that that are determined to take their trauma, their depression, their doubts of life, but most of all their failures, and apply DBT an go through the process of therapy, and achieve their goals & beyond.

The Staff are absolutely the best that “Money can Buy” it’s amazing the way the behavior specialist work with the amazing Nurses, the education department, the entire therapeutic society of Hillside but most of all how they literally manage, direct, and help the clients progress in such short time. “True Professionals “ The staff make the clients treatment a priority & Thats the best part about it,  

The staff treat each other with the highest respect and their are truly sincere in all they do
cons: It can be a challenge to watch a client learn and always apply DBT, you yourself have to have confidence in the skills, while observing the reaction from the clients as they increase their self confidence and self esteem in believing their past is not their future, as well as accepting things they can’t change and admitting perhaps they have experienced trauma and through therapy leads to a safe, secure, protected future

pros:
-Three meals a day and snacks provided free
-Get 3.5 days off during the week
-Hands-on clinical experience, good out-of-college first job especially if you want to work with a challenging population
cons:
-Terrible pay for the hard work you do, considering that you're a babysitter, counselor, and teacher's aid for the most challenging kids in the state of Georgia
-Daily physical restraints with clients that will bite, kick, scratch, hit, and spit on you
-Long 12-hour days (sometimes longer) with little to no down time
-Mixed messages from management and clinical staff regarding rules and clinical practices. Leads to confusion and arguments among staff. The kids realize that there is inconsistency and will completely take advantage.
-Management is very slimy. They will ask new hires to "rat out" current employees who they don't think are doing a good job. Certain members of the management never seem to step outside Monroe Building and have no idea what's actually going on at Hillside or who the kids are. Management is completely ungrateful for the stressful work  you do and the low pay. 
-Except for a few good meals, the food is pretty bad overall (no blame to kitchen staff. It's not their fault that people take advantage of the free food and they have to constantly make more.)

pros: A great company to work for with great benefits
cons: The hours and the job can be hard at times

review_title: Keep Looking for another job...But if you must.
pros: Great experience and hands-on. Good opportunity for recent graduates looking to build resume. This is a stepping stone job. Do not settle.  While working keep looking for  another job. Building a rapport with some of the patients is rewarding. However, this is a demanding job full of patients attention seeking throughout the entire shift!
cons: No support from up top. Unprofessional and not organized. Staff is underpaid and taken advantage of. A lot of stressful days and nights. Working 12 hr shifts and supervisors coming down hard on the employees. If a job isn't a necessity right now keep looking. Don't work here. The people up top, don't know what it's like to be on the unit with the patients. Cannot last 5 mins before they are trying to get out of dodge, however, they  are not understanding.  Turn over rate is extremely high. This job is appealing, but everything that glitters isn't gold. A lot of kinks need to be worked out. If people knew some of the things that was happening on campus, I wonder would there still be a Hillside.

pros:
Great Experience
Free meals while on shift
Great coworkers
Feeling of making a difference every day
Appreciation between employees for the work they do

Not sure why there are so many negative reviews about the work.  We know what we sign up for when we took on the role!  This is an entry level position for people wanting to work in mental health.  I've done my research and Hillside is one of the BEST mental health providers to work for in Georgia!  I LOVE it here!
Recent management changes have created a "renewed" excitement around campus.  I recommend it to anyone starting out in a career in mental health.
cons: The shifts are really long - 12 hour shifts AND you get 3 days off between shifts so it balances out.

review_title: Hillside is a GREAT place to work!
pros:
I love working at Hillside. The people here genuinely care  about the work that we do.  We are changing lives at Hillside for the better and it is an uplifting experience. The employees are amazing and willing to work as a team. Management is accessible and always willing to listen and talk to all employees. Hillside has a family atmosphere. 
There is room for growth as a person, and as an employee. You will learn so much working here.
cons: The population of clients can sometimes be difficult to work with.

pros: Great hands on learning.  Superb first job out of college if you are interested in the mental health environment.  Management very communicative with staff.  Have to be a self starter to stay motivated to work with this population of kids.   They try to make it a fun place to work.  Great family atmosphere.
cons: Long hours.  Pay is not that great but it is an entry level job so not surprising.  Pretty standard across the industry.

pros: Knowing you make a change in the lives of the children is fulfilling. Team oriented atmosphere, you are able to develop close relationships with coworkers.
cons: The company does a good job reassuring workers that they are expendable. The pay is well below what one should expect to receive having a bachelors degree. HR does a horrible job showing they care about underpaid over worked employees. You will not be able to go to HR about issues dealing with your supervisors because they typically have a close relationship. Supervisors don't seem to care about their jobs or the children. Management seems really detached from the clients they are supposed to be servicing. There is little room for advancement.
